meanings.definition: A person, animal, or plant with an unusual physical abnormality.
meanings.sent1: The circus had a show with freaks who had two heads.
meanings.sent2: People stared at the freaks in the sideshow tent.
meanings.sent3: The freaks in the zoo made the children giggle.
meanings.sent4: The field of wildflowers was a garden of freaks, each unique.
meanings.sent5: The freaks in the science fiction movie had glowing eyes and tentacles.

meanings.definition: A person who is obsessed with a particular activity or interest.
meanings.sent1: The gaming freaks spent hours playing their favorite video game.
meanings.sent2: She was a fitness freak, always at the gym.
meanings.sent3: The book freaks in the library whispered excitedly about the new release.
meanings.sent4: His friends called him a music freak because he knew every song.
meanings.sent5: The fashion freaks at the mall were dressed in the latest trends.

meanings.definition: To behave or cause to behave in a wild and irrational way.
meanings.sent1: The children freaked out when they saw a spider.
meanings.sent2: Don't freak out, it's just a little thunderstorm.
meanings.sent3: She freaks out every time she sees a mouse in the house.
meanings.sent4: The unexpected news freaked him out so much he dropped his phone.
meanings.sent5: The horror movie freaked her out, and she couldn't sleep that night.
